body:
Similar issue: 
https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_interop_master/1507/console

```
Loading composer repositories with package information
                                                                                                                                                                  


  [Composer\Repository\InvalidRepositoryException]                                                                                            
  No valid composer.json was found in any branch or tag of https://github.com/stanley-cheung/Protobuf-PHP, could not load a package from it.  



install [--prefer-source] [--prefer-dist] [--dry-run] [--dev] [--no-dev] [--no-plugins] [--no-custom-installers] [--no-autoloader] [--no-scripts] [--no-progress] [-v|vv|vvv|--verbose] [-o|--optimize-autoloader] [-a|--classmap-authoritative] [--ignore-platform-reqs] [packages1] ... [packagesN]


+ EXITCODE=1
```

I've this one several times today:

https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/view/Pull%20requests/job/gRPC_interop_pull_requests/677/console

```
Starting to download Console_CommandLine-1.2.0.tgz (39,740 bytes)
.........done: 39,740 bytes
install ok: channel://pear.php.net/Console_CommandLine-1.2.0
install ok: channel://__uri/Protobuf-1.0
Failed to clone the git@github.com:stanley-cheung/Protobuf-PHP.git repository, try running in interactive mode so that you can enter your GitHub credentials



  [RuntimeException]                                                                                                                                                 
  Failed to execute git clone --mirror 'git@github.com:stanley-cheung/Protobuf-PHP.git' '/root/.composer/cache/vcs/git-github.com-stanley-cheung-Protobuf-PHP.git/'  



install [--prefer-source] [--prefer-dist] [--dry-run] [--dev] [--no-dev] [--no-plugins] [--no-custom-installers] [--no-autoloader] [--no-scripts] [--no-progress] [-v|vv|vvv|--verbose] [-o|--optimize-autoloader] [-a|--classmap-authoritative] [--ignore-platform-reqs] [packages1] ... [packagesN]


+ EXITCODE=1
```
Lifting to P0 as this seems to be failing too often and slowing down our progress during the fixit. Let's talk today about what we can do.

Can we somehow make it not clone the git@github.com:stanley-cheung/Protobuf-PHP.git github repo always? Perhaps we could override the cloning source to clone from a local copy of the repo (that would be cached in the base Docker image). 

Btw, exact command from https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/tools/jenkins/grpc_interop_php/build_interop.sh is actually triggering this?
Leaving this open to see if #4371 helps.

Still seeing a similar problem. Occuring repeatedly.

https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_interop_pull_requests/876/console

```
Loading composer repositories with package information
Failed to update git@github.com:stanley-cheung/Protobuf-PHP.git, package information from this repository may be outdated (Failed to execute git remote set-url origin 'git@github.com:stanley-cheung/Protobuf-PHP.git' && git remote update --prune origin

)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Reading composer.json of datto/protobuf-php (codegen_add_options_param)                                                                       Reading composer.json of datto/protobuf-php (master)                                                                                                                                                                                                  Installing dependencies (including require-dev)
  - Installing firebase/php-jwt (v3.0.0)
    Downloading: Connecting...    Failed to download firebase/php-jwt from dist: Could not authenticate against github.com
    Now trying to download from source
  - Installing firebase/php-jwt (v3.0.0)
    Cloning fa8a06e96526eb7c0eeaa47e4f39be59d21f16e1

  - Installing react/promise (v2.2.1)

    Cloning 3b6fca09c7d56321057fa8867c8dbe1abf648627

    Downloading: Connecting...    Failed to download guzzlehttp/streams from dist: Could not authenticate against github.com
    Now trying to download from source

    Cloning 47aaa48e27dae43d39fc1cea0ccf0d84ac1a2ba5

  - Installing guzzlehttp/ringphp (1.1.0)
    Downloading: Connecting...    Failed to download guzzlehttp/ringphp from dist: Could not authenticate against github.com
    Now trying to download from source
  - Installing guzzlehttp/ringphp (1.1.0)
    Cloning dbbb91d7f6c191e5e405e900e3102ac7f261bc0b

  - Installing guzzlehttp/guzzle (5.2.0)

    Now trying to download from source
  - Installing guzzlehttp/guzzle (5.2.0)

    Now trying to download from dist
  - Installing datto/protobuf-php (dev-master c3831c8)
    Downloading: Connecting...


  [Composer\Downloader\TransportException]   
  Could not authenticate against github.com  



install [--prefer-source] [--prefer-dist] [--dry-run] [--dev] [--no-dev] [--no-plugins] [--no-custom-installers] [--no-autoloader] [--no-scripts] [--no-progress] [-v|vv|vvv|--verbose] [-o|--optimize-autoloader] [-a|--classmap-authoritative] [--ignore-platform-reqs] [packages1] ... [packagesN]
```
@stanley-cheung , we still keep seeing this one  and it's really impacting the reliability of our interop test suite. Let's talk about how to finally resolve this problem.
